result.execSummary:
The defendant DENNA RAE KARPE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Chippewa County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
PAYABLE TO CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE - 30 days to pay or request a payment plan. 
Due October 24, 2022.
All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

Plus supervision fees. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Any treatment as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Absolute sobriety.
No intoxicants.
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol. 
Not to possess or consume any alcohol. 
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Not to possess syringes unless medically required. 
No association with anyone using or possessing illegal drugs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. DENNA RAE KARPE

records.addlTxt: Return of CHSO's DNA sample/testing form letter

4:03 PM Defendant DENNA RAE KARPE appeared by video from Trempealeau Cnty jail, in custody.  Attorney David W. Field in court for DENNA RAE KARPE.  Attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to appear in person in court
Court finds defendant waives right to appear in person knowingly and intelligently 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing
Court finds defendant makes knowing and voluntary waiver of preliminary hearing

Court finds probable cause, binds defendant over for further proceedings 
Plea waiver filed in court from Attorney Field 

Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights. 
Defendant informed of charges and penalties. 
Factual basis and probable cause found.
Acknowledges prior conviction(s). 

Defendant pleas guilty to Ct 1 
Court accepts pleas as voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made and finds defendant guilty of Ct 1

Sentencing-
Withhold sentence, 36 months probation, absolute sobriety, no intoxicants, no sale, no alcohol, no para, no syringes, no assos, treatment per agent, court costs $518.00, DNA, 2 days jail credit if revoked, court quashes warrant
Plea hearing on September 21, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

10:15 AM Prosecuting attorney Sheila M. Yohnk in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant DENNA RAE KARPE not in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for DENNA RAE KARPE. 
Body, Statewide

Warrant not to be issued. 
Defendant provides phone number to the Court to receive text reminders. 
Bond continued.
Review hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

2:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Sara Matthews in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant DENNA RAE KARPE not in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for DENNA RAE KARPE. 
Counsel unable to get in contact with defendant, transportation issues. 
Warrant: body only - statewide. 
Warrant stayed until Friday at 10:00am.

10:35 AM Prosecuting attorney Sara Matthews in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant DENNA RAE KARPE not in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for DENNA RAE KARPE. 
Defendant has been in contact with Attorney and could not get a ride to court. To be scheduled for this afternoon.
Review hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Sara Matthews in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant DENNA RAE KARPE in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for DENNA RAE KARPE.
Review hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:22 AM Defendant DENNA RAE KARPE in court. Prosecuting attorney Scott Zehr in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant not to be issued.
Review hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:16 PM Prosecuting attorney Lawrence Jean Broeren in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant DENNA RAE KARPE not in court.  Attorney David W. Field in court for DENNA RAE KARPE.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
01:40 PM Defendant DENNA RAE KARPE in court with Attorney Lester H Liptak.  Scott Zehr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney waives reading of complaint. Defendant is informed of charges. Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 09:45 am.  Review hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial
monitoring conditions.
Defendant shall not possess any drug paraphernalia / syringes unless medically required.
Defendant shall not possess or consume illegal drugs / any prescription drugs not prescribed.
Not to associate with anyone using or consuming illegal drugs / drug paraphernalia.

Defendant DENNA RAE KARPE in court with Attorney Kirby Daniel Harless.  Defendant DENNA RAE KARPE in custody.  Scott Zehr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DENNA RAE KARPE appeared by video means with Attorney.
